It sounds like you didn't mean to do it. I don't think you're abusive. You had a trigger and responded from that. Yes you need to apologize, but also explain what led to your actions. Tell him about the trigger and your past relationship. You're not physically abusive if you have only done this one time and if you are actively trying to make sure it doesn't happen again. Your bf should be able to respect that you had a trigger and that it was an accident. If not, move on, and don't blame yourself too much.

It sounds like they gave you an ‚Äúonly if‚Äù condition. ‚Äú I only love you if you are *insert gender*. ‚Äù It‚Äôs heartbreaking when your parent(s) can‚Äôt love you unconditionally. I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre going through this

I would say she just sounds very insecure about you not spending all your time with her. You can't possibly spend every minute with her and your needs need to be met too. Those are her feelings, and whether they are wrong or right, they are still valid. You also have feelings that are important and valid. This just sounds like communication is needed, boundary setting, and compromising. Reassure her, but also state what you need. 

I love spending time with my husband, but I also like my alone time and that doesn't mean i don't want to be around him. It just means that I need to take care of my needs. My husband and I usually go to bed at the same time, but it's helpful because we have the same bedtime (11 or 12).
I love being left-handed, its so easy for me haha

That was the hardest realization that I came to accept with my Nparent. They won't ever own up to their shit and they won't ever apologize. They will never change and they will never love you the way you need to be loved. 

When you come to this realization, it is like grieving, because you're losing and letting go of the hope that your parent will never be what you need. You just now lost someone and it is okay to grieve over the loss and take time to heal and separate yourself from them.
Stop global warming. If Earth is healthy, then people are healthy
I have even blocked an email address and still get emails from them!!!

I‚Äôm definitely not there yet ( I‚Äôve struggled with anorexia), in regards to self-love, but I‚Äôm definitely on the path towards it. 
Self-compassion. My dietician told me that I needed to be more compassionate to myself. When my body isn‚Äôt doing what I want it to do ( for example, my body is in pain but I want to go to the gym anyways), I have to listen to my body and acknowledge that my body needs rest, or food etc. Being more compassionate to my body‚Äôs voice and needs, I have started developing self-love. And it doesn‚Äôt just have to be your body, but your mind as well. Listen to your body, tune in to what it‚Äôs saying. 

I think that has helped me the most, good luck on your journey ‚ù§Ô∏è

I have a pretty good relationship with my dad but it‚Äôs hard to be around him or talk to him when he‚Äôs trying to work things out with my mom. I feel like I can‚Äôt confide in him when he‚Äôs with my mom, he acts kinda weird and stuff ( given he is in a relationship with an abuser). 
I think I‚Äôll feel complete at my new apartment soon, hopefully within the next couple of weeks or sooner.

Yeah I‚Äôm trying to not keep any contact with my mom. I wake up fearful from those dreams that my mom is coming for me or she‚Äôs gonna try to manipulate me somehow. 
I‚Äôve actually lived with my husband before, but last year I was sick and couldn‚Äôt work so my parents let us share rent with them and move in to their rental house for a year ( I wish I hadn‚Äôt gone back to my mom for help). My husband is amazing and is the best support I‚Äôve ever had and so living with him is extremely helpful. Move in is complete but we are missing some furniture around the apartment and so I don‚Äôt feel ‚Äúcomplete‚Äù yet. 
Any advice I have about moving in with a partner is to keep up communication. Like if you have a problem, talk about it to your partner ASAP. And talk about splitting up chores and how money is going to work for you guys. I was blessed to have my partner who excels at communication so he taught me a lot.
I like to keep active but can‚Äôt do a whole lot with my current pain, but bike riding isn‚Äôt very painful and it‚Äôs fun for me. Thank you

I had another trauma dream last night about my abusive mom. The dream usually follows the same theme where I‚Äôm trying to escape my mom and/or I feel trapped by her. I recently just moved out of that house I was living in with her and now am in my apartment that I share with my husband.  All this moving has caused me to push myself too hard to get things done (even though I have a back injury) and it seems like I forget to keep in check with my body and end up doing way more than I am physically capable of. I‚Äôve been in a dissociative state for a bit now and I feel almost detached from my emotions/ feelings and my body ( like I forget to eat, drink water, go pee, etc)
Both honestly. Mostly the emotional stuff is what makes me feel suicidal, but the physical pain is also adding to the hopelessness. And I know the physical pain is part of my emotional pain

You still have two years left at high school and a lot of things can change in two years. I had a really rough junior year in high school and thought my life was over. Over the past five years, I‚Äôve attempted suicide 3 times. I can deeply emphasize with the struggles of life and school, especially when school feels like the only hope to a better future. I‚Äôm now a junior/senior at a university and I can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôve made it this far honestly. 
You reaching for an Ivy League school is an amazing goal! But don‚Äôt forget to be compassionate towards yourself if you don‚Äôt get to what you wished for. You‚Äôll still get a job with your degree no matter what school you go to. 

Your worth is not dependent on the university you get your degree.
What grade in school did you just finish? And what is your career goal about getting into an Ivy League university?

It sounds like you don‚Äôt feel heard and you feel alone. I‚Äôm so sorry you are struggling with this, I can completely empathize with your situation. It must be really hard when your family is telling you to get over it and your doctors aren‚Äôt finding a solution. I bet it must feel like nobody can understand the emotional and physical pain it‚Äôs giving you.
Sounds like it was a really rough school year for you. Is school really important to you?

I just got out of an abusive household and I thought once i moved into my apartment, that everything would be better and I wouldn't be depressed anymore. That obviously didn't happen and I am still struggling... I totally get it. It feels hopeless when this happens. It takes time to readjust. Give yourself another week, and by the end of the week, give yourself another week, and so on. Hang in there and take care
What has been going on lately that has made you feel that you are failing in everything you do?

I hear you, and I can deeply empathize with how you‚Äôre feeling. Im gonna share a thought with you... The butterfly effect, explained by the dictionary  is ‚Äúthe phenomenon whereby a minute localized change in a complex system can have large effects elsewhere.‚Äù Ive started to believe that every human being is like that. Your existence, and the lack of, has a huge impact on others, whether you believe it or not. Even the smallest thing you do, like smile at someone as you pass by them, can have a bigger impact than you think. Take care ‚ù§Ô∏è

Drinking is no excuse for her behavior. There have been studies done that show that drinking doesn't cause someone to be aggressive. Her BPD is no excuse for her behavior. There are NO excuses whatsoever for treating you that way. It is not okay. I understand why you'd want to be understanding of her situation and her feelings, because I do this too with my abusive parent. Either way, those behaviors are not okay and it is not your fault.
I‚Äôm from Oregon so it might be different there, but since you‚Äôre 18, you can probably apply for your own insurance now

The FAFSA thing sucks though, and can only be resolved once you‚Äôre married or are older than 24 unfortunately. But your school can work with you if you‚Äôre aren‚Äôt able to get your moms info for FAFSA.

My mom also threatened to take me off her insurance before too. Weigh the pros and cons. Are the things she‚Äôs willing to take from you more important than getting out? Take care of you first, and the rest will follow

If you didn‚Äôt actually commit the murder 2 years ago, then it doesn‚Äôt matter anymore. You should be able to safely tell your therapist about that

If you tell your therapist you have a plan to murder someone, they will have to report. If you‚Äôre just having thoughts about it, they probably will take it with caution and just talk to you about it to see what‚Äôs causing those thoughts.
